componentType.description: interfaces to the EyeX Gaze tracking system

eventListenerPort.description: to apply an offset correction to the current gazepoint
remove the last offset correction spot from the list of correction points
creates a new guest-profile and calibrates it
reset the x and y offset input port values to 0
enables setting of offset correction spots
enables the permanent offset correction mode
enables the combined offset correction mode
sends current tracking coordinates if SendCoordinatesEvent mode is active
start manual calibration of eyetracker (AsTeRICS based)

eventTriggererPort.description: triggered when long eye blink occurs
triggered when user fixates spot on screen for a particular time
triggered when user stops a fixation

property.name: enabled
property.description: selects if the eyetracker is enabled at startup

property.name: averaging
property.description: number of values for internal averaging of gazeX and gazeY outputs

property.name: minBlinkTime
property.description: minimum eye close time (in milliseconds) for triggering an eye blink event

property.name: midBlinkTime
property.description: eye close time (in milliseconds) to decide short/long blink event

property.name: maxBlinkTime
property.description: longer eye close times (in milliseconds) will not create eye blink events

property.name: fixationTime
property.description: time for triggering a fixation event (in milliseconds)

property.name: pupilPositionMode
property.description: the mode decides which pupil coordinates are sent to the posX and posY output ports: left eye, right eye or average; the coordinates are in the range (0-1000)
property.combobox: left eye//right eye//average of left and right eye//off

property.name: offsetCorrectionRadius
property.description: radius (in pixels) where offset correction spots are active

property.name: offsetCorrectionMode
property.description: correction spots: allows to add offset correction spots; permanent: permanently adds incoming offset values; combined: coarse positioning via eye gaze and fine positioning via offset inputs; by event: only send coordinates via incoming event
property.combobox: correction spots//permanent offset correction//combined offset correction//send coordinates by event
